Lutovac: Palmeru sam izneo stavove o neophodnosti stvaranja uslova za slobodne izbore

05 Nov 2019, 14:00

Predsednik Demokratske stranke (DS) Zoran Lutovac izjavio je danas da je na sastanku sa specijalnim izaslanikom SAD Metju Palmerom za Zapadni Balkan izneo stavove o neophodnosti stvaranja uslova za slobodne i poštene izbore u Srbiji.On je agenciji Beta rekao da je Palmeru preneo da je neophodno napraviti sveobuhvatan sporazum o izbornim uslovima na osnovu predloga koji su sačinili nezavisni stručnjaci u ime gradjana koji protestuju, a koji bi se mogao unaprediti predlozima organizacija Cesid, BIRODI, Transparentnost i CRTA i koji bi se primenjivao devet meseci pre izbora.Lutovac je kazao da je potrebno obezbediti mehanizam koji bi kontrolisao spovodjenje dogovorenog."Gradjani nisu informisani, glasaju pod ucenama i pritiskom, a nepravilnosti se ne sankcionišu. Da bismo imali slobodne izbore neophodna je sloboda medija kao i uslovi da se gradjani izjašnjavaju tajno i bez pritisaka, ali i administracija koja bi kontrolisala ceo izborni proces. Tek ako to uspemo da promenimo imaćemo elementarne uslove za izbornu trku", rekao je Lutovac.On je ponovio da bojkot ne znači odustajanje od izbora već da je bojkot usmeren na to da se "izborimo za ono što nam pripada za slobodne i poštene izbore".

Lutovac: I have stated to Palmer the necessity of creating conditions for free elections

05 Nov 2019, 14:00

Democratic Party (DS) President Zoran Lutovac said at a meeting with US Special Envoy Matthew Palmer for the Western Balkans that he voiced the need to create conditions for free and fair elections in Serbia.He told Beta that he had told Palmer that it was necessary make a comprehensive agreement on electoral conditions on the basis of proposals made by independent experts on behalf of protesting citizens, which could be promoted by the proposals of Cesid, BIRODI, Transparency and CRTA and applied nine months before the election.Lutovac said that a mechanism should be in place to control the implementation of what has been agreed. "Citizens are not informed, they vote under blackmail and pressure, and irregularities are not sanctioned. In order to have free elections, freedom of the media is required, as well as conditions for citizens to declare themselves secretly and without pressure, but also the administration which would control the entire election process. Only if we can change that will we have elementary conditions for an election race, "Lutovac said. He reiterated that a boycott does not mean giving up elections, but that the boycott is aimed at" fighting for what is right for us for free and fair elections. "
